Key Match Events: Kieffer Moore scored the fastest goal in Wales' history with a 37-second strike.
Harry Wilson scored a stunning 25-yard shot into the top corner for Wales.
Ben Davies made a superb goal-line clearance to deny Montenegro an equalizer.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales claimed their first win under new manager Craig Bellamy.
Karl Darlow became Wales' oldest debutant since World War II.
Montenegro recalled Stevan Jovetic, their all-time leading scorer.
Post-Match Reflections: Craig Bellamy praised his team's performance and resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales ended their goal drought with the first attack.
The match took place in Niksic due to Podgorica's national stadium being unplayable.
Wales' 800-plus supporters traveled over 50 kilometers to support the team.
